reviewText:
Pajama Sam: Where do I begin?

This game right here, Pajama Sam's Lost & Found. This game is the Citizen Kane of the digital world. It is so perfect, you would need to destroy it to make it any less good. I first recieved this from a friend. He sent it to me as a gift, and he said You gotta play this." At first I was sceptical. Was this Pajama Sam game any good? What would it be like? These questions were soon to be answered.

I installed the game. The 30 second download and installation time was a long wait
recommended: it was indeed worth it. I loaded the game. Instantly
voteText: like the game itself is congradulating me for installing the game. After that
helpfulPercent: I see a suggested age that says "3-8 Years Old". This was a false suggestion. No mere child could see how great this game was truly. I opened up the game
votesHelpful: and was instantly shocked by how amazing the opening scene was.\n\nA man
votesTotal: alone on his planet. It is his planet. He was strong enough to live there by himself. Without any warning
commentsCount: and lands on his planet. The man
column16: enjoyed to see someone other than himself
column17: welcomes the visitor in open arms. The visitor was a monstrosity that was out of Lovecraftian mythos. It rejected the man's offer of peace
column18: and instead chose an offer of war. The man agreed to this war
column19: just to defend his own planet. Everything stops. A woman's voice asks if someone would cleanup their room. This person was a god
column20: who orchestrated the events on the planet. This person... was Pajama Sam.\n\nPajama Sam put on his glorious red cape
column21: and ran under his bed to find lost goods. After arriving under his bed
column22: they were suddenly in a river. Sam leapt onto a boat
column23: and then a wonderful German voice greeted me. After this point
column25: 50 TB computer with 24 GTX 780 Ti's with Liquid Nitrogen cooling seemed to be having a panic. Weird sounds began to spew out
column26: and then... BANG. My computer exploded
column28:
and died. It had seemed like Pajama Sam had destroyed my computer with its sheer minimal requirements. I still know the glory of Pajama Sam today.

Music: 240000000/10
Gameplay: 23343000000000/10
Story: 6422343400000000000000/10
Graphics: 11/10"

reviewText: I freely admit that I enjoy playing this game. I'm sure many of you will think me childish for liking a childish game. I assure you I am not. I used to love this game when I was a kid. I would play for what seemed like hours day after day. I probably racked up around 20 hours of this game as a child, and I can honestly say that those hours were full of enjoyment, just as my time playing this on Steam has been.\nIf you want a game that's actually pretty fun and lets you reminisce and puts a smile on your face no matter how rough your day was, buy this. I'm sure many of you haven't played Pajama Same before, but trust me,\nIt is so worth the money.

reviewText:
This game has changed my life. Before i got this game i was a weak beta who only managed to scrape through life by the skin of my teeth. I was 5'6 and weighed 300 pounds and had more grease in my hair than a McDonalds deep fryer. No girl would touch me, i was nothing. That all changed when Pajama Sam came into my life. His sheer determination to find all of his lost items inspired me to change my life. I forced my self to grow till i was 6,5, i then started to work out and got a body that causes women to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ at the sight of me. Pajama Sam has made me a better person.

Pajama Sam is Love

Pajama Sam is Life


11/10
Would Bang.

reviewText: Yeah this is about as engaging as I expected (not at all). Arcadey side-scrolling thing where the screen autoscrolls and you pick up a bonus puzzle piece. Levels aren't distinct enough to keep me entertained at all, the bonus minigames are generic as well, I dunno. I tend to find myself only playing through the humongous arcade games when there's at least some semblance of level design, so basically just the puzzle games yeah. Oh well.

reviewText: Pajama Sam's Lost & Found is another spin-off game featuring everyone's favorite boy with big imagination. In this game, Sam has to clean up his room so he imagines finding all of his stuff by going through various worlds he has visited in the first two games along with some new worlds exclusive for this game. Otto the Boat & King the Mine Cart from the first game return along with the Forklift from the second game. While the only new characters are Rosie the sled and Trigger the wagon. So the game has a bit of old and new concepts mixed together for this spin-off. Its an arcade style game containing 100 levels of a slide scrolling level where you collect points, power ups, and items while avoiding obstacles. There's even bonus items to collect in order to do a choice of three different bonus levels for additional points. The only flaw I have with this game is that sometimes its hard to know how far you need to jump over an obstacle. But its a flaw I can look past while playing this game. The best way to beat this game is either writing done the codes for each level or the option to skip levels you feel is too hard to trek through. Overrall this game has its fun factor and can keep you occupied for a few hours.
